title: What New York City Borough are You?
description: A subjective quiz based on common prejudices and personal opinions - and with a little bit of truth.

answers.answer: Baseball!
I used to do Zumba, planking and aerobics, but now I'm into padel
(Ice) skating and parkour
Soccer, cricket or tennis
Garden work and long walks

questions.title: Let's put on some music. What do you pick?

answers.answer: A raw old-school hip-hop mixtape.
I just discovered a new British DJ called Fried Alain. You have to check it out pal!
I prefer a total immersive experience: a musical or a big arena show of an A-list pop star
I've got a great playlist with Spanish, Dutch, German, and Greek music
Elvis!

questions.title: What is your main concern when you are offered a job?

answers.answer: I want a job where I can directly interact with customers. I'd rather have a decent paycheck to support my after-hours hobbies.
My work needs to be my creative outlet: I'd like to start my own design studio.
Work hard, play hard. I don't mind long hours, as long as I'm fairly compensated.
I'll do the job, as long as I've got some time to spend with my family in the evening
Physical work gives me satisfaction

questions.title: We're almost there: are you a city person?

answers.answer: I connect with people, not with bricks. I feel most at home when I'm part of a movement.
I like the city, but not the noise, and certainly not the overly modern sky scrapers. Rather, I'd renovate an old charming house in a creative neighborhood.
I thrive in the urban jungle.
I want to live quietly in a family-friendly neighborhood, which is close to where it all happens
I used to live in the city, but now I prefer to watch from a distance

questions.title: Last question already! If you're not hungry already, you certainly will be. What's your favorite food?

answers.answer: Something quick: a hotdog during the game.
A pok√© bowl, sushi or frozen yogurt.
A burger at McDonald's, Wendy's, Shake Shack, Taco Bell, Five Guys, ...
Authentic ethnic food
Traditional, simple food

results.title: the Bronx
results.description: What do home-run heroes, hip-hop history and hand-pulled mozzarella have in common? You can find them all in the Bronx‚Äîthat is, when you‚Äôre not wandering hundreds of acres of parkland, touring historic homes or strolling along New York City‚Äôs answer to the Champs-√âlys√©es.
results.me_description: Yo, I feel at home in the Bronx! What about you?

results.title: Brooklyn
results.description: Hipsters and history buffs agree: Brooklyn is everyone‚Äôs style. The most populous borough has no one defining draw‚Äîpeople come for live music, eclectic eats, pro sports, immigrant history and world-class culture. Of course, you‚Äôll cross paths with all kinds on the majestic span of the Brooklyn Bridge.
results.me_description: I am a 'Brooklyn-person'! What about you?

results.title: Manhattan
results.description: Manhattan truly feels like the heart of it all. Broadway and Times Square sit at its electric center, but famous landmarks and household-name attractions can be found all over the island. Beyond the iconic are countless neighborhoods promising great rewards to those who explore.
results.me_description: Big City life: I'm at home in Manhattan! What about you?

results.title: Queens
results.description: Queens is one of the most diverse places in the world. Many get their fill from the food scene alone, which ranges from exquisite Greek souvlaki to the best hot pot outside of Sichuan. The borough is also a major destination for sports fans, nature lovers and modern-art aficionados.
results.me_description: Always felt quite royal: my NYC neighborhood is Queens. What about you?

results.title: Staten Island
results.description: Easily accessible by a scenic ride on the Staten Island Ferry, the greenest borough feels like a getaway within the City. Beyond a charming North Shore rich with maritime history, Staten Island is best known for its beaches, vast parkland and even a fully preserved colonial village.
results.me_description: Kick back and relax, I belong in Staten Island. What about you?
